special.text:
Special rules:

The tasks are revealed one at a time. The commander asks everyone if they want the task. They answer with “yes“ or “no“ and the commander distributes the tasks evenly.

special.5: The commander asks everyone how they feel. They answer with “good” or ”bad”. The commander decides who is ”sick”. That person cannot get a trick.
special.9: A 1 has to win a trick (rockets don't count).
special.11: The commander picks one player who is not allowed to communicate.
special.12: After the first trick, everyone draws a card from their right neighbor.
special.13: Every rocket has to win one trick.
special.16: No trick may be won with a 9.
special.17: No trick may be won with a 9.
special.20: The commander picks one player who has to do all tasks.
special.23: You may swap two tokens (1/2/Ω/etc.) before picking the tasks.
special.24: The tasks are revealed one at a time. The commander asks everyone if they want the task. They answer with “yes“ or “no“ and the commander distributes the tasks evenly.
special.26: Two 1s have to win a trick each (rockets don't count).
special.27: The commander picks one player who has to do all tasks.
special.29: At any point in the game no player can have won two more tricks than any other.
special.32: The tasks are revealed one at a time. The commander asks everyone if they want the task. They answer with “yes“ or “no“ and the commander distributes the tasks evenly.
special.33:
One player has to win exactly one trick without using a rocket.

The commander asks everyone if they want the task. They answer with “yes“ or “no“ and the commander picks the player.
special.34:
The commander has to win the first and the last trick.

At any point in the game no player can have won two more tricks than any other.
special.36: The tasks are revealed one at a time. The commander asks everyone if they want the task. They answer with “yes“ or “no“ and the commander distributes the tasks evenly.
special.37: The commander picks one player who has to do all tasks.
special.40: Players may move one token (1/2/Ω/etc.) from one task to another task without a token before picking tasks.
special.41:
One player has to win only the first and last tricks (and without using a rocket).
The commander asks everyone if they want the task. They answer with “yes“ or “no“ and the commander picks the player.
special.43: The tasks are revealed one at a time. The commander asks everyone if they want the task. They answer with “yes“ or “no“ and the commander distributes the tasks evenly.
special.44: Every rocket has to win one trick. The order has to be 1, 2, 3, 4.
special.46:
The player with the red 9 reveals themselves.

The player left of them has to win all red cards.
special.48: The Ω task has to be done with the last trick.
special.50:
One player wins only the first 4 tricks. One player wins only the last trick.
The commander asks every player for their preference and the whole team decides.
special.51:
NOW GO PLAY THE TEAM II!

It is very similar but has more diverse tasks.

comm1.css: border-radius:30%;font-size: 65px; font-weight: bold; color: black; border: none;

fields.text: It looks like the game is currently in progress and sitting down or standing up would reset it. Please use the button 'Deal' to reset the game first.

info.description: Cooperative trick taking card game. Work together on mission tasks to ensure that certain tricks are taken by certain players, all while not revealing your hand.
